com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface YFSBeforeCreateOrderUE


  • public interface YFSBeforeCreateOrderUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document beforeCreateOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)

      The YFSBeforeCreateOrderUE user exit is called by the createOrder API before executing any application logic.

    • Method Detail

      • beforeCreateOrder

        java.lang.String beforeCreateOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                   java.lang.String inXML)
                            throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YFSBeforeCreateOrderUE user exit is called by the createOrder API before executing any application logic. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit to manipulate data obtained from content providers (for example, different applications for order entry, or different web sites having different forms for placing orders) and provide a standard input XML as required by the createOrder API.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Input xml:
        PaymentDetails element under PaymentMethod element is deprecated, it is replaced by PaymentDetailsList element such that multiple payment details can be passed at a time for a payment method.Refer to input xml.

        Pre-conditions: The user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain input XML data as required by the createOrder API.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to either raise errors or access environment information.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        A valid createOrder input XML. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.


      • beforeCreateOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document beforeCreateOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
